leaflet.candidateName: Alison Frost, Richard Hopkin, Abdus Samad

messages.title: DECENT HOMES FOR LOCAL TENANTS
messages.content: Refurbishment and renewal of Camden's council properties through 'Decent Homes' programme, supported by Conservative councillors â€” making good structural improvements neglected by Labour.

messages.title: 121 HOLBORN REJECTED
messages.content: Camden council rejected the application by Blue Diamond to open an 'adult supermarket' on the basement of the Gamage's Estate on Holborn.

messages.title: HOLBORN JOB CLUB
messages.content: The Holborn Job Club gives strength to job strength, and continues to help people back to work. Richard Hopkin said, 'Holborn Job Club gives support and advice to residents seeking work, guidance to prepare them for the job market, and an opportunity to share their experience to provide mutual support and gain access to high quality help free of charge.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support for refurbishment and renewal of Camden's council properties through the 'Decent Homes' programme, highlighting successful housing improvements and ongoing projects.

mentions.candidate: Alison Frost, Richard Hopkin, Abdus Samad specifically mention their efforts and presence at 121 Holborn.
mentions.tacticalSituation: The leaflet includes a graph comparing the Conservatives to Labour and Lib Dem, indicating a competitive local situation and the potential for tactical voting based on the historical voting results shown.

housing.content: Support for ongoing refurbishment and renewal of council properties to provide decent homes for local tenants. Opposition to the opening of an adult retail business in the area.

images.caption: Alison Frost, Richard Hopkin, and Abdus Samad

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet touches on local issues such as opposition to certain retail openings, Crossrail conversations affecting residents, and road closures impacting local traffic. The leaflet also promotes proactive involvement in local job support with the Holborn Job Club.
